about.heading:
Builder mindset,
legal trajectory.
paragraphs: I'm a pre-law student at the University of Tennessee at Chattanooga, pursuing a B.S. in Criminal Justice with a focus on law. Since late 2025, I've shipped production websites for small businesses, a political campaign, and an early-stage SaaS product.
I'm drawn to the intersection of technology, business, and regulation — building real things while working toward a legal career.

process.heading:
From idea to live
in days, not months.

steps.title: Discover
steps.description: We talk through your business, goals, and what's not working. No fluff — just clarity on what needs to be built.

steps.title: Design
steps.description: I build a focused layout around your customers and conversion goals. Every decision is intentional.

steps.title: Build
steps.description: Clean code, fast load, mobile-first — shipped on Vercel. No bloat, no templates, no shortcuts.

steps.title: Launch
steps.description: Live, tested, and ready to drive real inquiries from day one. You own everything.

items.question: How long does a project take?
items.answer: Most sites ship in 1–4 weeks depending on scope. Landing pages can go live in under a week.

items.question: Do I own the code?
items.answer: Yes. You own everything — code, domain, hosting account. No lock-in.

items.question: What do you charge?
items.answer: Pricing depends on scope. Reach out and I'll give you a straight answer within 24 hours.

items.question: Can you maintain the site after launch?
items.answer: Yes. I offer lightweight retainers for updates, hosting, and performance monitoring.

contact.heading: Let's work together.
contact.intro: Pick the channel that works for you — I respond fast.
